name: places/ChIJOR-kG8RYwokRnhLHam2MRqA
formattedAddress: 525 E 71st St 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 525 E 71st St 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: Called to make an appointment. Was told I had to bring my MRI disk in and reports relating to my leg. I had a stress fracture in my tibia. Was told Dr. Ricci would look everything over and they will call me if he would see me. Got a call the next day that he would see me. Got there both girls at Nuclear Medicine and Orthopedic desk was very rude. There is a sigh on their desk saying they don’t tolerate bad behavior. They should read that sign. Get in to see Dr. Ricci and he tells me he doesn’t deal with stress fractures, only broken bones. Obviously he never looked at the disk and papers I brought in the week before!  Came in from New Jersey twice to tell me he can’t help me!!! Really!!! I’m sure he got a good amount of money from my consultation only to tell me he can’t help me!!!  What a waste of my time. I would not recommend him and girls at front desk need a lesson on behavior and not me rude.

originalText.text: I had a bad broken left clavicle that I went to two other orthopedic doctors for opinions. Dr. Ricci was my third and final. Levels above the rest in knowledge and direction. I am now four months post surgery and couldn’t have healed better. If you are able to get in with Dr. Ricci take it because you will not get a better surgeon on the East coast. I have just read other reviews on here about personality and bedside manor. At the end of the day, would you rather the best orthopedic surgeon around operate on you or a mediocre surgeon with personality. By the way, Dr. Ricci was very serious, knowledgeable and right to the point. As I would want my surgeon to be. 10/10 on my experience.

originalText.text:
Hello There. My name is Yoskaira. I had a surgery on my right leg, screws and a metal plate. The surgery took place on 04/28/2023. It was My first time ever. I was scared.
The comments made me think he would be so RUDE....I WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED.

Perhaps he used to be like this years ago. Now he is gentle, Patient, explains things thoroughly, comforting. I 100% recommend him. Right now I'm waiting for the post op follow up, and thought to take my time to recognize this man.

People EVOLVE and GROW. so I can say from my personal experience he is AMAZING.

I will update once my leg is healed. Much love to you. Take My advice, do YOURSELF a favor. Come to this man.

originalText.text: I was referred to Dr Ricci for removal of hardware in my knee. He was very callous and to date l, 7 days later I have received no post operative care.  He did not answer my numerous calls due to pain and excessive swelling.  He provided almost no postop instructions and did not speak to me after surgery whatsoever.  I had to go to the emergency room 7 days later for care. I have never felt so neglected by a doctor and am concerned about any long term effects of his work. I have had two other doctors at HSS and never had an experience like this.  Not sure if it is because I am a black woman that I have been ignored and left without any care or resources from him or his team.

originalText.text: I am now 5 months after shoulder and elbow surgery.  I am almost completely "back to myself".  I had a bad traumatic injury.  I could not be more pleased with the care that I received by Dr. Ricci and his staff both before and after the surgery.  I continue to be grateful that I was in the hands of such an outstanding surgeon as Dr. Ricci.
